text: Satori in Paris is a 1966 novella by American novelist and poet Jack Kerouac. It is a short, autobiographical tale of Kerouac's trip to Paris, then Brittany, to research his genealogy. Kerouac relates his trip in a tumbledown fashion as a lonesome traveler. Little is said about the research that he does, and much more about his interactions with the French people he meets. ==Editions== *1966. Satori in Paris, *1982. Satori in Paris, Granada Publishing, *1988. Satori in Paris & Pic, *1991.
